SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection
Class RootDetector

java.lang.Object
  com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection.RootDetector

public class RootDetector
extends java.lang.Object

When a user has root privileges on a device he has total control over the environment, this allows one to e.g. change behaviour of applications running on the device. This RootDetector class aims to detect and report this situation.

Because root privileges enable total control any tests for them will always be based on heuristics; the root user is in theory always able to trick the code. Our RootDetector class however is pretty exhaustive and provides a lot of different approaches to detect root. By default all of these will be executed but for some applications this might not be required or preferable. The use of our configuration flags enables fine-tuning our checks for your purpose.

The isDeviceRooted() methods should ideally not be executed on the UI-thread or on hot code paths / loops. We also recommend using these methods in a couple of different places and applying other DexGuard techniques to protect and hide them in order to prevent an attacker from easily removing the calls.

Field Summary
static int AVOID_MISCONFIGURATION
          Avoid tests that might return in false positives on misconfigured devices.
static int IGNORE_BINARY_EXISTENCE
          Don't factor in the actual existence of an 'su' binary on the system.
static int NO_CIRCUMSTANTIAL
          Don't take circumstantial evidence as proof of root.
static int NO_FAIL_ON_HOOKING
          Don't consider the device rooted if our check itself was tampered with.
static int NO_TRICK_APPS
          Don't scan for applications whose sole purpose is to hide from / trick root detection libraries.
static int SILENT
          Don't under any circumstance cause feedback for the user.

Method Detail

isDeviceRooted

public static int isDeviceRooted(int ok,
                                 int flags)
Checks whether the device has been rooted.

Parameters:
ok - a return value that can be chosen freely.
flags - a series of optional flags allows to limit testing.
Returns:
'ok' if not rooted, an error code indicating which test failed otherwise.

isDeviceRooted

public static int isDeviceRooted()
Checks whether the device has been rooted.

Returns:
0 if not rooted.

isDeviceRooted

public static int isDeviceRooted(int ok)
Checks whether the device has been rooted.

Parameters:
ok - a return value that can be chosen freely.
Returns:
0 if not rooted.
